sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4} be two sets. Determine the symmetric difference of (A △ B) △ A and A △ (B △ A), where "△" denotes the symmetric difference and the Cartesian product is denoted by "x".
